channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report E-2023090346
item.description:
Report E-2023090346

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: DICKSON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 12, 2023, at 1550 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Dickson, Tennessee regarding the release of approximately (40) gallons of Isopropyl Alcohol 70% (UN1219, 3, II). The shipment had 26 pallets of an unknown amount of boxes. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that the release was from 26 crushed cardboard boxes all together containing (312) 16-ounce bottles. The release was due to too much weight on top of the boxes, crushing the boxes and bottles inside, and contained to a 5’x 4’ area of the trailer floor. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (4) 55-gallon DF which was then taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023090280
item.description:
Report E-2023090280

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: BLOUNTVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NTR experienced a 0.5-cup release of UN3264 Descale SS12 from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and transferred the product from the damaged tote to a new one. The crew advised a release was not observed, it may have dried to the tote body prior to their arrival. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized with absorbent pads into a 55-gallon poly drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023081968
item.description:
Report X-2023081968

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-20T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-21
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking fiberboard box with no diamond labels found on unload. Box taken to HMPA staging pallet. Upon further investigation, it was discovered package was already damaged 8/21 around 2PM at 392 JAMS, Rankin County. DPR contained observation that internal content was cracked and commented: "The white paint is busted open and spill inside the box." DescribePack: All four plastic drums lost lids, resulting in a 16lb loss of hazardous material. Two nonhazardous drums also lost content. No internal partitions found. At least one drum cracked 2" across bottom. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, SDS consulted, and ventilation used.

item.title: Report X-2023081707

Report X-2023081707

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking fully regulated fiberboard box found on HMPA staging pallet. Prior events unknown. DescribePack: One of four 1 gallon plastic bottles lost 0.4 gallon from a 0.6 inch gouge to the upper corner of the bottle, not following a seam. Due to impact from a sharp object. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned and ventilation used.

item.title: Report X-2023081618
item.description:
Report X-2023081618

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking metal drum discovered in middle area. Immediately placed in a lined tote and taken to HMPA staging pallet for further investigation. DescribePack: 1 inch crack with two smaller branches found on metal ridge of bottom of drum. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, SDS found attached to drum, ventilation used.

item.title: Report X-2023081608
item.description:
Report X-2023081608

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-20T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023081608 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE DISCOVERED WET IN BULK AREA. PACKAGE REMOVED AND GIVEN TO QA DescribePack: FULL HAZMAT HAD BEEN REPACKED IN FEDEX REPACK BOX WITH NO HAZMAT LABELS ON OUTER BOX. LOOSE CAPS ON BOTTLES ALLOWED ABOUT 10 LITERS OF RAPICIDE PART B TO SPILL OUT. SOME RAPICIDE A MAY HAVE BEEN SPILLED AS WELL. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED IN LINED CONTAINER. 2. X-2023081651 SequenceEvent: WET PACKAGE DISCOVERED IN BULK AREA. REMOVED FROM WORK AREA FOR PROCESSING. DescribePack: PACKAGE FOUND REPACKED IN A PLASTIC BAG AND INSIDE A REPACK BOX. LOOSE CAPS ON BOTTLES ALLOWED CONTENTS TO SPILL OUT. BOXES WET. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED IN LINED CONTAINER FOR PROCESSING

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package mitigation consisted of putting package in an open contents bin and leaving for OB QA to process.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. 2 boxes of paint spilled inside a ULD. One box containing 2 cans leaked, the other package was leaked on (no release). All remaining contents were placed in salvage drums and held pending disposition from the shipper.

item.title: Report X-2023080441
item.description:
Report X-2023080441

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-19T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Memphis spill agent was called to the second floor of the SPSS building for a USPS package that had caught fire. The box was observed smoking and on fire a manager in the area extinguished the fire before any other packages were affected. While investigating the Fiberboard box they discovered that it contained a cell phone. The outer fiberboard box had no haz markings or paperwork. All the contents were placed into a steel salvage package. The salvage package was turned over to USPS employees. USPS tracking# 9238590250484602328718

item.title: Report X-2023080421
item.description:
Report X-2023080421

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-19T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Memphis spill agent was dispatched to heavy weight build up for a damaged haz shipment. A shipment on a wooden skid was struck by a forklift damaging one of the fiberboard boxes on the bottom row. The fiberboard box contained four metal cans all with positive closure rings and were separated with fiberboard dividers. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023080420
item.description:
Report X-2023080420

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-19T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Memphis spill agents was dispatched to the dangerous goods building for a leaking fiberboard package. The box contained 2 paint cans and fiberboard dividers. There was no positive closure on the paint cans. Each paint can was enclosed in a single clear plastic bag sealed via bag tie. The lids on both paint cans were slightly ajar allowing the leakage of content. Shipper will be contacted for an amended declaration for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023080419
item.description:
Report X-2023080419

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-19T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Fiberboard package was presented to the Memphis spill office as an odor. While investigating the package the spill agent observed that the single metal can inside had released its contents inside of the fiberboard box. The metal can was not packaged with positive closure and had styrofoam peanuts for dunnage. It was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023080418
item.description:
Report X-2023080418

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-19T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Memphis spill agent was dispatched to the Dangerous Goods Building for a fiber board box with signs of release. The box contained 20 bottles of various sizes. The bottles were separated into 4 separate clear plastic bags sealed via bag ties. Each individual bottle was enclosed in bubble wrap and wrapped in a hazmat pad. One of the bottles was shattered and released all of its contents. The shipper was contacted for an amened declaration for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023080411
item.description:
Report X-2023080411

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-19T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-03
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Memphis spill agent was dispatched to the Dangerous goods building for a fiberboard box with signs of a release. The agents was told that the fiberboard box had been dropped during the unloading process. Inside of the fiberboard box were four metal jerrycans. One of the jerrycans had a damaged bottom chime causing to release it's contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023081208
item.description:
Report X-2023081208

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-15
  • City: KODAK
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was found on the ground by the 300-line I.C. re-induct. The box was immediately placed in a hazardous materials red tote to stop the spread of its leaking contents. The package was then moved to the hazmat cage to be worked by QA. Upon inspection it was found that all the caps on the 4 bottles had failed, which caused the damage. DescribePack: The loose caps on each bottle cause the contents to leak out at a mild rate DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Quick dry was applied to the minor spillage on the floor then QA swept it away into a hazmat bag. The area was then mopped clean.

item.title: Report X-2023081207
item.description:
Report X-2023081207

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was noticed leaking on the flex slide, where it was quickly removed and taken to the QA area. DescribePack: The spray bottle leaked at the cap. It and a non-hazardous spray bottle were packed sideways in a horizontal box, against the orientation arrows on the outside. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The carton was placed in a lined tote and taken to the QA area.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Lined tote with hypochlorite odor found on unload with one flap of outer packaging. Removed to HMPA for further investigation. DescribePack: One of two 5.32L plastic bottles lost all 5.32L from a 3" gouge to the bottle body (not following any seam) from a impact with a sharp, protruding object. The other 5.32oz bottle and 32oz spray bottles of the same material were intact. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned and ventilation used.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA identified leaking hazmat package in unload. Upon inspection it was discovered the cap on one of the gallon containers was loose, causing the internal leakage. Package was wet when unloaded from trl# 832534 OLIV on door 116 in unload from 3:02-5:04pm. DescribePack: One of the caps on one of the gallon containers was loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA identified the leaking hazmat package and immediately responded with appropriate materials and procedures to mitigate release.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Inner cans had lose caps and the package was overhead sorted because no hazmat markings DescribePack: both can lids came open leaking into package DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed in a lined tote

  • Description: A Plastic jerrycan was dropped during the unloading process at the Memphis dangerous goods building. The jerrycan hit the corner of the catwalk causing a puncture on the bottom. The jerrycan was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was quickly removed from sort, placed in a lined tote. The leakage was confined to the carton.

item.title: Report X-2023080901
item.description:
Report X-2023080901

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-16T00:32:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-22
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A bag containing aerosol cans was damaged coming down the flex slide. Upon inspection, it was discovered that two of the cans had discharged. The bag was quickly taken to the HMPA. DescribePack: The cap was broken completely off of one can. The other had been compressed enough to discharge some contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was quickly taken to the HMPA, where it was placed in a lined tote. Spillage was confined to the inside of the padded mailer.
